item.title: [tip]Makefile
item.description: Build c/c++ project always need third party library on linux, such as gtk+, glib. Writing their absolute path in Makefile is not flexible way. You can use pkg-config instead of the absolute path. Below is code snippet: GTK_LIB=$(shell pkg-config –libs gtk+-2.0) GTK_INC=$(shell pkg-config –cflags gtk+-2.0) gcc -o yourlibrary.so $(GTK_INC) $(GTK_LIB)
